data: RESP AMB Thoracentesis and Thoracentesis Drainage (Multiphase)
Review allergy status prior to Thoracentesis
Nurse to initiate Pre Procedure phase of this plan
Ensure consent for Thoracentesis has been obtained by a Provider and documented in the chart
Consider reviewing anticogulation as per Thrombosis Clinic Protocol
Clinical event: Thoracentesis, Medication(s) to be held: Anticoagulant:_____, Instructions: _____
10 mL, intrathoracic, as directed, order duration: 1 doses or times, drug form: inj
20 mL, intrathoracic, as directed, order duration: 1 doses or times, drug form: inj
10 mL, intrathoracic, as directed, order duration: 1 doses or times, drug form: inj
20 mL, intrathoracic, as directed, order duration: 1 doses or times, drug form: inj
10 mL, intrathoracic, as directed, order duration: 1 doses or times, drug form: inj

10 mL, intrathoracic, as directed, order duration: 1 doses or times, drug form: inj
20 mL, intrathoracic, as directed, order duration: 1 doses or times, drug form: inj
Nurse to initiate Post Procedure phase of this plan
Discontinue Pre Procedure phase of the AMB Thoracentrsis and Thoracentesis Drainage (Multiphase) Powerplan
T;N, Other, When Vital Signs are stable, patient may be discharged
T;N, Once on admission and prior to discharge
T;N, q15min for 1 hour then as per unit policy

Significant change of blood pressure or heart rate and/or oxygen saturation less than 90% and/or severe pain and/or excessive coughing (Clamp thoracentesis catheter if severe pain and notify physician)
Consider discussing with patient when to resume anticoagulant medication(s) (if applicable)
dose range: 325 to 650 mg, PO, q4h, PRN pain, drug form: tab
Thoracentesis, Unit collect, Collected, T;N, once
Routine, Reason: Post Thoracentesis Left Side, Special Instructions: PA and Lateral View
Routine, Reason: Post Thoracentesis Right Side, Special Instructions: PA and Lateral View
